definition: head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: Four years ago, he suffered an ignominious first-round exit.
sentences.chinese: 四年前，他遭受了首轮出局的耻辱。

sentences.english: Nowadays a lot of startups don't want to raise multi-million dollar series A rounds.
sentences.chinese: 很多初创企业不愿进行动辄上百万的首轮资金筹集。

sentences.english: Instead, Orlando Magic first-round draft pick Daniel Orton has learned patience.
sentences.chinese: 然而奥兰多魔术首轮秀丹尼尔奥尔顿得先学会耐心。

sentences.english: She narrowly won the first race.
She beat him by a large margin in the first round of voting.
sentences.chinese: 在首轮投票中，藤森庆子大幅领先于库辛斯基。

sentences.english: The first round of multilateral trade talks has lurched between hope and despair.
sentences.chinese: 首轮多边贸易谈判在希望与绝望间来回摇摆。

sentences.english: More than 100 transsexual people applied for the first round of jobs.
sentences.chinese: 在首轮招聘中，100多名变性人提交了申请。

sentences.english: Highlights of the opening round included home wins for Hangzhou Lucheng and Tianjin Teda.
sentences.chinese: 首轮比赛精选包括杭州绿城和天津泰达主场获胜。

sentences.english: Hinrich got injured in the first round of the final battle with Magic.
sentences.chinese: 辛里奇是在首轮与魔术的最后一战中受伤的。

sentences.english: The Los Angeles Lakers have offered a future first-round pick to Minnesota for completing the transaction.
sentences.chinese: 湖人队同森林狼交易的筹码是未来的一个首轮选秀权。

sentences.english: You need to pay at least 200 dollars to see the first-run movie.
sentences.chinese: 你至少要花200元才能看到首轮电影。

sentences.english: They also have two more first-round draft picks.
sentences.chinese: 他们也拥有了两个以上的首轮选秀权。

sentences.english: Politics more than economics guided the design of the first stimulus, after all.
sentences.chinese: 终究，政治而非经济主导了首轮刺激的规划。

sentences.english: Most students who pass the prelims started studying before spring quarter.
sentences.chinese: 大部分首轮通过的学生都在春季学期就开始备考。

sentences.english: I know that included in the trade was a future first-round pick.
sentences.chinese: 我知道卷入交易的还有一个将来的首轮选秀权。

sentences.english: The Clips have made 29 first-round picks since 1980.
sentences.chinese: 自1980年以来快船队拥有29个首轮选秀权。

definition: second round (of a match or election)
to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag
an upset (esp. in sports)/unexpected turn of events/to pull off a coup/a breakthrough
poised for battle/to square up for a fight
